bill_title: revise the term of employment for a county highway superintendent.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the term of employment for a county highway superintendent. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 31-11-1 be amended to read as follows: 31-11-1. The board of county commissioners at its discretion may employ a county highway superintendent, the salary and expenses to be fixed and allowed by the board of county commissioners , to be paid out of the motor vehicle fund of the county. No member of the board of county commissioners shall may be appointed as county highway superintendent. The tenure of office of the county highway superintendent may be terminated at any time by resolution of the board of county commissioners upon thirty days' notice, but unless so terminated, the tenure of office shall be for two years. The term of office of the superintendent commences upon appointment and may be terminated as provided in § 3-17-6 by the board for poor performance, incompetency, gross immorality, unprofessional conduct, insubordination, neglect of duty, or the violation of any policy or regulation of the county. The superintendent's term of office may be terminated upon not less than ten working days notice. However, the board may dismiss the superintendent, without cause, anytime within one year of the date of appointment. Any vacancy shall be filled in the same manner as the original appointment.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
